pullrequest.title: Add gtest-1.6.0.diff file to indicate the current version (#927)

content.raw: This somewhat looks redundant to me. Any reason not to just point to embedded version of gtest and if you need to check changes going to proper place (gtest web or source) and look for them?
content.html: This somewhat looks redundant to me. Any reason not to just point to embedded version of gtest and if you need to check changes going to proper place (gtest web or source) and look for them?

pullrequest.title: Add gtest-1.6.0.diff file to indicate the current version (#927)

content.raw:
My only goal for this is to identify the version number of our copy of gtest, since there is currently no version number listed anywhere. It seemed clean to me to include this file, but I suppose we could alternatively have a text file that says, "We are using gtest 1.6.0 with just one line added in include/gtest/gtest-typed-test.h". What would you rather see?

~~~
# Starting in gazebo's `hg root`
cd test
wget http://googletest.googlecode.com/files/gtest-1.6.0.zip
unzip gtest-1.6.0.zip \
  gtest-1.6.0/include/* \
  gtest-1.6.0/src/* \
  gtest-1.6.0/cmake/*
rm -rf gtest/include gtest/src gtest/cmake
mv gtest-1.6.0/* gtest
~~~
~~~
diff -r c3ca8d288bfa test/gtest/include/gtest/gtest-typed-test.h
--- a/test/gtest/include/gtest/gtest-typed-test.h	Wed Oct 30 14:59:11 2013 -0700
+++ b/test/gtest/include/gtest/gtest-typed-test.h	Wed Oct 30 17:40:49 2013 -0700
@@ -31,7 +31,6 @@
 
 #ifndef GTEST_INCLUDE_GTEST_GTEST_TYPED_TEST_H_
 #define GTEST_INCLUDE_GTEST_GTEST_TYPED_TEST_H_
+#pragma GCC system_header
 
 // This header implements typed tests and type-parameterized tests.
 

~~~
content.html:
My only goal for this is to identify the version number of our copy of gtest, since there is currently no version number listed anywhere. It seemed clean to me to include this file, but I suppose we could alternatively have a text file that says, "We are using gtest 1.6.0 with just one line added in include/gtest/gtest-typed-test.h". What would you rather see?

# Starting in gazebo's `hg root`
cd test
wget http://googletest.googlecode.com/files/gtest-1.6.0.zip
unzip gtest-1.6.0.zip \
  gtest-1.6.0/include/* \
  gtest-1.6.0/src/* \
  gtest-1.6.0/cmake/*
rm -rf gtest/include gtest/src gtest/cmake
mv gtest-1.6.0/* gtest

diff -r c3ca8d288bfa test/gtest/include/gtest/gtest-typed-test.h
--- a/test/gtest/include/gtest/gtest-typed-test.h   Wed Oct 30 14:59:11 2013 -0700
+++ b/test/gtest/include/gtest/gtest-typed-test.h   Wed Oct 30 17:40:49 2013 -0700
@@ -31,7 +31,6 @@

 #ifndef GTEST_INCLUDE_GTEST_GTEST_TYPED_TEST_H_
 #define GTEST_INCLUDE_GTEST_GTEST_TYPED_TEST_H_
+#pragma GCC system_header

 // This header implements typed tests and type-parameterized tests.

pullrequest.title: Add gtest-1.6.0.diff file to indicate the current version (#927)

content.raw: 100% agree with the need of knowing what version are we using. Any simple solution would work for me, a line in a header file or even including an empty file ```GTEST_VERSION_1.6```
content.html: 100% agree with the need of knowing what version are we using. Any simple solution would work for me, a line in a header file or even including an empty file GTEST_VERSION_1.6
